credentials: PHD 2010 Univ of IL at Urbana-Champaign
name: Christa OLSON

ratings.comment: There are some really hard tests.
She basically sums up the reading in the lectures so I know a lot of people who get away without doing any of the reading.

Professor Olson was a very kind, inclusive, and understanding professor. Her TA was as well. However, I found the grading contract concept to be elementary. For example, an A was equal to an "exceeds expectations," a B to "meets expectations," and so forth as I understood it. Also, she assigned extensive readings that we barely talked about.

Like another reviewer said, clearly has a political agenda and there is no original thought that goes into her materials and lectures. Easy A, but also a cheap indoctrination attempt and no actually inspiring, thoughtful content.

I dont believe in the whole "college liberal indoctrination" idea, but I can see how someone would get that idea if they saw this class. Prof Olsen clearly has a political agenda as she uses the overbroad definition of "rhetoric" to teach what is basically a history class about how white people oppress everyone. Easy A but waste of time.

Professor Olson is very flexible and responsive to students' needs. It is clear that Professor Olson puts in a lot of time and effort to make this class as adaptive to students' needs as possible. If you put in the effort to show up to class, participate, and turn in the assignments, you will get an A.

So great... super easy course because you set your own grading contract, she is super flexible/easy going, and it is mostly based on group participation. I really enjoyed how laid back this course was.

Possibly the least impactful English professor I had in undergrad. Room for independent thought was given but disingenuously. Not really up to being challenged, very tied to her own vocabulary and field. If you are up for regurgitating language or elaborating on what's been said you will be applauded, but it wasn't the class for me.

Christa is a fabulous professor. She clearly knows her stuff and really works hard to enrich the academic growth of her students.  Her classes aren't easy, but classes shouldn't be easy! She makes sure you really learn and is always there to help.

Energetic and engaging. She tries to makes sure her students understand class topics. She will let you extend the deadlines for assignments and offers the opportunity to change things after they've been graded, for a chance at a better grade. Lots of reading. Stay on top of it and it'll be a great class.

Christa is great—down to earth, informative, and knowledgable. She treats her students like adults and committed learners, and affords students the freedom to explore topics that interest them. Total rock star!

She doesn't teach because she doesn't know social science.  The class is methods, but she only knows historical methods; she kmows zero about ethnography, CA or anything outside her specialty.  Very old-school with feedback and very thin-skinned when challenged by students.  Avoid if possible.
